analyzeResult.content:
PHILIP MORRIS USA INTER-OFFICE CORRESPONDENCE 120 PARK AVENUE, NEW YORK, NY 10017-5592
To:
AII PM USA Employees
Date: January 25, 1996
From:
Denise F. Keane
Subject:
Policy Regarding Contacts with Governmental Representatives and Outside Counsel
Governmental Representatives
We would like to remind all employees of the Philip Morris policy regarding requests for informa- tion or inquiries received from representatives of any governmental body or agency that relate to the Company or its business.
To ensure that we are appropriately responsive, that requests are properly coordinated, and that we protect proprietary information, if you are contacted by a representative of any bureau, branch or division of a local, state or the Federal government, in relation to the Company or its business, you should report such contact immediately to me as General Counsel of Philip Morris U.S.A. This policy applies to requests for interviews, meetings, on-site or off-site visits, and documents. In addition, any information that may be provided must be reviewed in advance by the Legal Department to ensure completeness, accuracy, and proper coordination.
The contact from the government may take the form of a letter, a subpoena, or a phone call to you at the office or at home. Such contacts are subject to the policy described above. This directive does not apply to otherwise ongoing communications with an agency which maintains a continuous or frequent presence at a Philip Morris facility.
Any legal papers received by a Philip Morris employee, that relate to the Company or its business (summons, complaint, subpoena, discovery requests) must be immediately forwarded to the Legal Department. As papers may arrive by mail, courier, or fax, business mail must be opened and reviewed on a regular basis.
Please refer to the Legal Guide for Employees for a general discussion of this policy.
Outside Counsel
We also request that no employee speak with outside counsel or paralegals/legal assistants of outside counsel, in relation to the Company or its business, unless you have been advised by a member of the Legal Department that you will be receiving a call from outside counsel, or unless you are personally familiar with the attorney or paralegal/legal assistant, and the Legal Depart- ment is aware of the communication.
If any employee receives any phone calls from outside counsel requesting information, docu- ments, etc., you should refer the caller (unless the above referenced exceptions apply) to Claire Carcich in the New York office (x3722) or Chris Hardin in the Richmond office (x2823) who are in the Legal Department.
Thank you for your cooperation and assistance regarding these matters.
2056957860
